title: How to Take Part in the Bracelet Project

steps.headline: Gather beads in the colour(s) that represent your issue.
Make a bracelet out of the beads.
steps.description:
You can combine colours if you're dealing with more than one disorder (for example, if you're dealing with depression and suicidal thoughts, make your bracelet half blue and half yellow). If you are trying to recover, add a white bead. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3f\/Take-Part-in-the-Bracelet-Project-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Take-Part-in-the-Bracelet-Project-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/3\/3f\/Take-Part-in-the-Bracelet-Project-Step-2Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Take-Part-in-the-Bracelet-Project-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>
\n<\/p>


\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Wear your bracelet and look out for other people wearing similar bracelets.
steps.description: The rules are if you see a person wearing the same coloured one as you, make eye contact and point to your bracelet. If the person nods, they are part of the Bracelet Project.

text:
Gather beads in the colour(s) that represent your issue. "} Although obesity is grouped as a physical disorder, people often experience psychological distress due to bullying. You can combine colours if you're dealing with more than one disorder (for example, if you're dealing with depression and suicidal thoughts, make your bracelet half blue and half yellow). If you are trying to recover, add a white bead. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Take-Part-in-the-Bracelet-Project-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Take-Part-in-the-Bracelet-Project-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3f/Take-Part-in-the-Bracelet-Project-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Take-Part-in-the-Bracelet-Project-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

"} Wear your bracelet and look out for other people wearing similar bracelets. The rules are if you see a person wearing the same coloured one as you, make eye contact and point to your bracelet. If the person nods, they are part of the Bracelet Project.
